Most likely.Description: The most likely outcome in the 1 day timeframe is increased food prices and shortages in certain countries due to disruptions in Ukrainian agricultural production.
Most likely.Explanation: Based on the information provided, it is highly likely that disruptions in Ukrainian agricultural production will have significant impacts on the global food system. The global model developed by the Complexity Science Hub reveals that shocks to the supply chain often exceed direct effects, indicating that the indirect effects of disruptions in Ukrainian agricultural production will be substantial. This will likely result in increased food prices and shortages in certain countries that rely on Ukrainian agricultural products. For example, a shock to Ukrainian barley production would lead to a loss of more than 21% of poultry and eggs in Kuwait and more than 15% of poultry in Saudi Arabia. The loss of corn production in Ukraine would leave countries like Estonia, Latvia, and Syria without the ability to process more than 60% of their own corn-related products. These disruptions will have immediate consequences in the 1 day timeframe.

Most likely.Description: The most likely outcome is that there will continue to be a shortage of organs available for transplantation, leading to a high demand and long waiting lists for individuals in need of life-saving transplants.

Additionally, the use of living donors for kidney and pancreas transplants has increased the availability of organs. These advancements could potentially lead to a decrease in waiting times and an improvement in outcomes for individuals in need of transplants.

These challenges make it unlikely that the shortage of organs will be completely resolved in the near future.
